intro: Hieracium submerum, commonly known as the submerged hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in moist soils along riverbanks and wetlands. Its leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Hieracium submerum is often found in shallow water or submerged conditions, making it an important species in aquatic ecosystems.
